Zak's head is underwater, his eyes are open wide and his cheeks are puffed as he holds his breath. The voices above on the raft are muted by the sound of bubbles and chop lapping against the makeshift boat’s hul

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: The nerve you must have to even think--

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: People that call Zak a retard are only saying that he can’t do something they can. So you might not be saying the word retard but you're sure as shit making him feel retarded.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No. I’m not kidding you. You’re just as bad as they are. You make him think he is completely incapable of doing anything on his own. Zak comes up, gasps for air and interrupts them.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Time!

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Nice work dude!

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: How long was that?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Pretty long.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Not long enough. Do it again,

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Zak slams his face back into the water. Zak.  64.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Do you even know what I do? I’ve spent the last two years of my life volunteering to hold widows’ hands as they slip from this world to the next. I’m the one they look at when they take their last breath--

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE RAFT
dialogues.text: Zak holds his breath and surveys the water below. His eyes open wider as a large fish swims close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor speaks with more conviction, she and Tyler are po opposites but share a common goal, Zak’s best interests.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Don’t pretend because you took Zak on a camping trip for a night or two that you know anything about my life. I didn't ask for Zak to be placed in a retirement community. I didn’t choose that for him. But that’s what happened, and now I’m doing what needs to be done. Tyler's frustration turns to admiration for Eleanor’s passion. He is beginning to understand her point of view. Zak explodes out of the water holding large fish by the gills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak all sit in a circle around the fi roasting on a ramshackle spit over a small burn barrel.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Three options today for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Three options! Yeah! Eleanor, warmer than before, looks like she is enjoying t because Zak is so happy.  65.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Option one. Hot water we boil from the sound.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: BLECK! I don’t want to drink more sound water, Tyler!

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Option two is plain fish.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You know what I want, Tyler. Eleanor smiles at how much fun Zak is having.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Option three is...FISH with PEANUT

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: FISH and peanut butter!! I want to eat the fish with the peanut butter!

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (to Eleanor) We gotta give the guy what he wants!

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Yes you do! Tyler tears the fish apart with his bare hands and passes chunk to Zak who already had a handful of peanut butter ready. He rubs the peanut butter all over the flaky white meat and immediately starts eating. Tyler then rips off another piece and hands it to Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Try to eat around the bones. Tyler digs in. Eleanor looks at her handful of hot fish scrap and eats.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say it’s gourmet... Tyler and Zak look at her, slightly offended.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you boys did great. Eleanor smiles at Tyler, acknowledging his efforts. Zak does his secret handshake with Tyler as Eleanor watch

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: It’s a secret handshake we do when stuff is really awesome.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: It’s what we do to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Yeah, we did it when I almost got ran over by that big boat.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: That boat was a close one. Eleanor swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: And we did it when someone shot a gun at us but we didn’t get any bullet holes in our bodies.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Oh God. Tyler winks at Eleanor, and gives a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: A BARGE
dialogues.text: Tyler turns the crank on his radio. A bluegrass song abou summer comes on. Tyler and Zak take turns jumping off of a rope swing that hangs from the hook of a crane stored temporarily in the reeds. Tyler teaches Zak to hold on to the rope tight and Eleano watches, impressed with how much Zak is learning and by h much fun they are having.  67. Tyler flips through the air followed by Zak doing a karat kick.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Tyler and Zak sit on a barge, playfully calling to Eleano she stands on a stack of pallets getting ready to go off rope swing.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: It’s so easy, you just jump, and hold on, and then you let go. (beat) Hold on. Let go.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: The rope does all the work, you just enjoy the ride.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: OK! OK! I’m going. Stop rushing me.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: On the count of three, OK? TYLER (CONT’D) ZAK One! Two! Three-- One! Two! Three--

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I’m going! Eleanor takes a deep breath, lets go and swings. She releases the rope and hoots joyfully as she falls int the water. Tyler and Zak match her energy, throwing their arms in th air to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak sail their raft through open wate Light from the late afternoon sun reflects off the surfac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan and Ratboy stand at the camp fire Zak and Tyler da around the night before. Ratboy is trying on Zak’s makeshift falcon wings. Duncan picks up the empty peanut butter jar and smells it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor and Zak slow dance on the raft as it floats slowl down a glassy creek lined with 1,000 year old cedars. The fire in the small burn barrel beside them casts flickering light on the knotted stumps and twisted branch of the trees that surround them. Tyler watches happily, using a 12 foot push-pole to guide them forward through the water. His movements are fluid a smooth, and the raft glides along almost effortlessly. The energy between the three of them has fully shifted, Eleanor is now a part of the team. For the first time she doing what she thinks is right and not what she’s been to to do. Eleanor places Zak’s hand on her hip as they move.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Good. That’s it. (beat) How does your ankle feel?

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Ummm...it is really great now Eleanor, thank you. Zak looks down at his feet. He counts with her.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three. One. Two. One. Two. Three. One. Two. Three. Three. The sun sets behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look into my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: But, I need to look at my feet.  69.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: No you don’t. You can do it. Zak and Eleanor look into each others eyes as she counts.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One. Two. Three. Good Zak, good. Zak smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: This is a good story that we will tell.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I like when we are all together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man’s voice hushes another. The sound of liquid being poured in the darkness. A match is struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak sleep peacefully on the dusty flo of a room filled with duck calls and decoys. Tyler's sleeping face is abruptly illuminated by a harsh flickering light. The raft is on fire! Tyler wakes up and runs toward the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler looks at the burning raft in disbelief, powerless. Duncan enters the frame.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: We've been looking for you. A gun cocks.  70. Ratboy stands 10 feet to the side of Tyler, holding a pis aimed in his direction. Tyler puts his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on your knees. Tyler lowers to his knees. Zak peeks out fearfully from the hunting cabin window, th burning raft illuminates his face. Eleanor is still aslee behind him. Duncan stares at Tyler; and then leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s twelve thousand dollars of gear that’s burnt up. You know how many hours I’m gonna spend braiding wire. I got mouths to feed. (beat) What’s gonna stop people from thinking they can cut the buoys off our pots now that you've done it? Or burn our gear up? (beat) Them Vietnamese are looking for an excuse to start pulling pots again, and you know how that got handled. Tyler listens.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m glad it wasn’t me that had to put that hammer down, but someone did. And it’s better now. Ratboy squirms with pride and discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cops aren’t gonna do anything and you know it. A few month's probation and that’s it? Nah, you gotta get what’s coming to you; not revenge for revenge sake, but for the rest of us, for our livelihood. (beat) If no one else is gonna do this then I see it as my job to get done. Duncan nods at Ratboy who nods back.  71.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Duncan-— BANG! A gun shot goes off. Duncan looks startled as Zak, holding Tyler’s shotgun, st out from the cabin door. Zak points the weapon directly at Ratboy who is still pointing his pistol at Tyler. Eleanor, emerges behind Zak. She looks startled, not know what is going on or who these men are.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (to Tyler) I didn’t know you were traveling with friends. (to Zak) You the brains of this outfit? Zak's shotgun wobbles a bit, but he stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: RATBOY
dialogues.text: (to Zak) You can pull that trigger, but can you aim that thing? Duncan starts to make a move toward Zak. Zak widens his stance.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (to Ratboy) It’s buckshot. This stops Duncan’s forward momentum. Ratboy looks to Dun Duncan motions for him to put the pistol on the ground. Tyler stands and backs up a few paces.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (to Zak) What’s the play then bud? Zak pumps his shotgun. Eleanor takes control and places her hand on Zak’s should

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: You don’t want to spend the rest of your life in a jail cell.  72.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (to Duncan) You're going to get in your boat and you’re gonna leave. I won't come back to Colington, you'll never see me again, and we call it even on the crab pots. The fishing license is yours.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: It already is mine. Tyler makes eye contact with Zak.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (to Duncan) Then we do it different. Zak ignores Eleanor’s pleas and raises the shotgun higher with bravado.

dialogues.speaker: DUNCAN
dialogues.text: (to Zak) I guess you’re the boss.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I guess I am. Duncan and Ratboy slowly retreat toward their boat as Zak keeps them in his crosshairs. They start the engines and drive off. Once the boat is out of sight, Eleanor runs over and thro Ratboy’s handgun into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, Zak, and Eleanor walk silently down the beach thre abreast still shaken from the standoff with Duncan and Ratboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ayden pier sits dormant, the town is still asleep. Ty reaches under a control panel and rubs two wires together sparks fly and the Ferris wheel comes to life. All three are illuminated by the colorful lights.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: (to Tyler) Is that why you’re out here? Were you running from them? Tyler nods.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think they’1l come back for you? Tyler thinks as he activates the motor. The wheel starts rotating.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No...I think it’s over.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: All three sit close in the car at the top of the Ferris w and watch the sun climb out from behind the ocean. The first light of the day breaks on their faces. Eleanor rests her head on Zak.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, my mom used to let me keep all of her change. She got me a piggy bank that looked like a soccer ball. I kept a record of how much I had in there. I had this little notebook in my bedside drawer so I could record it, with the date next to it and everything.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What were you saving up for?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: No idea, nothing, just saving. I just did it to make her happy.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: How much did you have?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Almost four hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (smiles) That’s more than I have right now.  74.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yeah...our house burned down.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everything was fine; we got the dogs out, thank God. But we lost all our family photos and keepsakes.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Did you get the piggy bank?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Shoulda spent that money.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I’m not used to this, just living in this moment right now. Not planning, not worried about the past or the future. Just right now. It feels really nice. The horizon turns from pale pink to a bright orange.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: All three exit the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Give me just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Tyler stands alone knee deep in the water. Eleanor and Za chat softly in the distance. Tyler gently lays the shotgu into the water with both hands; he is content. He turns back to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor, sitting in a booth by the window, plugs her cell phone into a wall charger.  75. The phone turns on.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yes Glen, I’ve got him with me right now. She looks through the glass at Zak and Tyler, who practic Tai Chi in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, he’s OK. Some sunburn and a couple scrapes but nothing’s broken. She watches Tyler as he and Zak do their secret handshake

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, he was completely alone. (beat) No don’t send anyone, I can handle it. (beat) I’m thinking tomorrow some time later in the day, I’ve got to call a locksmith, and I’ve got some loose ends to tie up, so can you transfer me to Janice, we need to have clean sheets put on Zak’s bed. (beat) What? No. Yeah I labeled hima flight risk but-- (beat) Glen, I can handle him from here on, I just-- (beat) Cherry Hill is a mental health facility with drug addicts and prostitutes, you can’t just put Zak in a place like that and expect-- (beat) No, you're right, that’s not my job. I just think Zak would be better suited-- (under her breath) Why are you doing this? (beat) Nothing...OK, schedule his processing for later tomorrow then. Eleanor hangs the phone up and gently hits her head again the glass window.  76. A WAITRESS (62), approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can get for you hunny? Eleanor looks defeated, but recomposes.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Have you heard of the Salt Water Redneck?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Everybody knows Salt Water, he used to be a celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: I need his address. EXT. PARKING LOT.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I am going to walk right up to him and say “I am here to learn the wrestling moves! SO TEACH ME! BOOYAH!”

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S TRAILER - DAY Tyler knocks on the door of a dilapidated trailer. Thirty feet away, Zak stands hidden behind Eleanor, just of earshot; he is unexpectedly shy. Long pause. Tyler knocks again.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Maybe this is the wrong house. Tyler looks at a piece of paper with the address on it in Eleanor’s handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No. This is it. Finally... The door opens and a much older and tired look Salt Water Redneck, without makeup or long hair, steps in the light.  77. He is a shadow of what he once was, almost unrecognizable

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Are you The Salt Water Redneck? He notices Zak.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, is this is the wrestling school?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Who's askin?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: My name’s Tyler; I ain’t selling nothin’ to you. You see that guy back there?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tyler swallows and holds back tears.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Well, we done some hard traveling to get to you. It’s a big deal seein’ you here. You mind just waving to him? (beat) He’s got a lot riding on this you mind just waving to him? Salt Water looks beyond Tyler to Zak hiding behind Eleano

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: How ya doing? The Salt Water Redneck awkwardly lifts his hand and waves Zak waves back.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Hey.  78.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: You don’t teach no wrestling school here no more?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: I closed that about ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Did you? (beat) So I promised him he could do this one thing. This wrestling thing. And he told me about this school here in Ayden. (beat) Now I gotta break his heart. (beat) And I don’t really know what to say to him. (beat) What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Clint. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: So... He used to be a fan?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Oh, more than that. Shit, you're his hero. (beat) He believes in you... That’s a hard thing to do, believe in something. Zak watches on. He can’t hear what they are saying.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling to Zak) Zak. This is Clint. Zak pokes his head out from behind Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Salt Water Redneck) You mind if he comes up here and says hi?  79.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: That'd be alright.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (to Zak) Come on up here. Zak walks to join Tyler at the door.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey pal The Salt Water Redneck don’t live here no more. (beat) Clint is just a regular guy like me or you and he wanted to shake your hand. Zak wears his disappointment on his face and reaches out shake Clint’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Good, nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Alright bud, let’s go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler, Zak, and Eleanor all walk in silence.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Tyler? Tyler just listens, somber.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I bet we could find him, if we all go look for him together on a raft. (beat) The three of us could find him, Tyler. You, me and Eleanor can find him. I bet he’s hiding out ina swamp.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (softly) Zak, The Salt Water Redneck isn’t real; he doesn’t exist.  80.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Yes he does. I have the videotape. I have seen him.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Zak, It’s over now, you’re coming back with me.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: But you told me I could do it, Tyler. You promised me that a strong person like me could do it. (beat) Let’s not go back. We can take care of each other. We can be a family. I can catch the fish. I’1l be the hero always for you guys. (beat) I can take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: We have lives we have to get back to.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Is your life better than this? Eleanor truly considers this question.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is your life better than this right now? Is your life better than the raft we made? It’s not and you know it! We love each other! You love each other, and I love you! (beat) It’s simple.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: It’s not simple. Zak lets this sink in.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zak, I can’t--

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You won’t. You can. You just won’t. Long pause. An old, beat-up and rusty Pontiac Firebird complete with flame engulfed phoenix decal on the hood comes speeding u the road from behind them.  81. The horn plays Dixie and the engine roars as it comes to screeching halt, spraying dust. Zak looks at the fiery bird on the hood as the dust settl The Salt Water Redneck adjusts his blonde wig and bandana he gets out of the driver’s seat. His makeup job looks rushed, he wears blue camouflage briefs and knee-high wrestling boots.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: I heard that there was a Salt Water Redneck fan here that came to enroll in the wrestling school. Zak smiles from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Salt Water Redneck walks over to Zak and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: My name is Clint, but my friends call me The Salt Water Redneck. (beat) I would like it if you called me The Salt Water Redneck.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Redneck... Zak takes a deep breath and kneels before Salt Water.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am here to learn the wrestling moves! Please teach me your ways, oh powerful one! I will do the best I can for you. I will make you proud, Salt Water Redneck. Salt Water looks pleased with his redemption.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Teach me to throw.  82. EXT. WRESTLING RING - SALT WATER’S FRONT YARD - DUSK Salt Water enthusiastically teaches Zak wrestling moves i homemade ring comprised of ropes strung between a few sho stuck in the ground and a lawn mower handle. Salt Water briefly introduces Zak to his roommate, SAM (5 an intimidatingly large man who sports a mullet haircut a wears a faded work-issued, pest-control shirt. Sam watches intently beside the ring with his arms crosse He enjoys watching the two wrestle, but for different reasons. Salt Water feels good to be back in the makeshift setup. He has fun with Zak as he shows off. Salt Water teaches Zak to stomp his foot when he pretends hit someone. Sam watches with focus but doesn't say much. Salt Water rolls on the ground showing Zak how to properl take a fall.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Ummm... What about the “Atomic throw?”

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) We made that move up just for the videos. It was smoke and mirrors, you know, it was just a camera on my face so it looked like I was holding someone over my head. It’s not possible. See, try to pick me up. Zak tries to pick up Salt Water, but his weight is too mu He stops and sighs. Salt Water notices Zak getting upset. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) My manager thought a gimmick might sell more mercy. The “Atomic Throw” was just a publicity stunt. Zak looks disappointed.  83. Salt Water takes a deep breath. Back to reality. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) Now grab the back of my neck like this and pull me toward you. Tyler and Eleanor watch Zak and Salt Water from an old co that looks as if it has been sitting outside for years.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: After today, after all this, where are you headed? Tyler smiles at the thought of the future prospect.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Florida. (beat) A fresh start. I’m gonna get my own boat and run charters. Take people sport fishing. Make a few bucks while living the good life. It’s gonna be great. (playfully) If you don’t have any plans you can come with me. Eleanor flashes Tyler a look: “Yeah right.” EXT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S TRAILER - NIGHT - LATER Salt Water, Zak, Eleanor, Tyler, and Sam all sit at a pic table, eating boiled corn and hamburger helper off paper plates. Christmas lights, casually strung, help set the m

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: It takes years to learn certain things, like how to take a fall. You get better with time. If you just apply that stuff in a match, change it up here and there, try not to do the same move twice or whatever, you’re pretty good to go.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: OK, yeah? OK.  84.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Alright, let's try it for real. Sam takes notice of what Salt Water is saying.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Try it for real?

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Yeah, let’s get you in a ring. Not just practicing moves here with me. I'm talking about a backyard brawl, a real match with real moves.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I don’t know if he’s ready--

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, that seems a bit fast--

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (to Eleanor) It’s not like he’s got all the time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I want to do the wrestling match.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Sink or swim as far as I see it. Let’s do it tomorrow in Jacob's backyard. (to Sam) You're on the bill, right?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (begrudgingly) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Great, you two can fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt Water drives; Zak rides shotgun. Eleanor and Tyler a squeezed into the back with Sam uncomfortably wedged betw them. Salt Water wears normal clothing, his hair blows in wind; Zak doesn’t look nearly as confident. Pink fuzzy handcuffs dangle from the rear view mirror. Everything is quiet.  85. Salt Water stiffens his grip on the steering wheel and abruptly starts screaming at the top of his lungs. Zak is taken by surprise. Salt Water starts slapping Zak’s chest with the back of h hand like a football coach might do to hype up his star quarterback. Eleanor and Tyler lean forward and share confused glances around Sam's gigantic body. Finally, Zak joins in with the screaming. Tyler is next to follow suit, he reaches across Sam, and grabs Eleanor’s hand, and she joins in as well. All except Sam ride in the Firebird screaming at the top their lungs like wild animals. Sam sits stoic and silent, unaffected by the energy of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson(Sam’s wrestling alter ego) stands on top of an eig foot ladder in the center of the wrestling ring. He is covered in blood holding a bat wrapped with barb wire. A small crowd of people drink beer and hoot for the show. The words “JACOB'S INFERNO” sit above a barn door that is painted entirely in red, orange, and yellow flames. A broken-down school bus separates the tattered bleachers from the parking lot. Samson howls into the air and does a front flip landing e feet below onto a table where his opponent lies. The table splits in half. Both men hit the ground with a thud. Ribs crack and Zak’s eyes widen. Samson digs his fingers into the eyes of his opponent, wh writhes in pain dramatically. Samson is circling the ring holding a gold belt above his head.  86. In the crowd, Craig (the unforgettably obese character fr the fish docks), laughs obnoxiously at the violence. Tyler stiffens at the unmistakable sound of Craig’s laugh the two lock eyes. Zak looks nervous as he watches Samson; he is not prepare for this. Salt Water stands on the other side of the ring being gre warmly by JACOB(48), the events emcee and referee who hol bullhorn. Jacob is a gruff showman who is missing a tooth started The Inferno just for the love of wrestling. Salt Water points toward Zak, and Jacob looks across the chaos to size him up. Jacob shakes his head no. Zak swallows nervously. Salt Water looks like he is pleading his case. Finally, J nods, then shakes hands with Salt Water. Salt Water hands him a small piece of paper. Craig pushes through the crowd and opens a phone as he ex

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: (into the bullhorn) We are going to have a special exhibition here for you shortly folks. The Tidewater’s very own Salt Water Redneck has brought with him a wrestling protégé. Salt Water comes back over to where Zak, Eleanor, and Tyl are standing.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: Alright! We’re good to go! Had to do a little convincing but I greased the wheels. You’ll fight Sam after this. Sam hits his opponent in the face with a metal chair. Teeth fly. The small crowd cheers wildly. Zak is shaken. Eleanor takes it all in.  87. INT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S FIREBIRD - DAY In the parking lot, Tyler and Eleanor speak in private in of Salt Water’s Firebird. The sounds of Samson’s wild how grunts, and yells punctuate their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Clint said Sam is going to go easy on him. It'll be simple, a couple moves and he will lay down and let Zak win.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: No. No, this is different Tyler--

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: You said I could have all of him. A savage howl followed by a shriek causes Eleanor to paus

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Not this much.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: (beat) OK. Eleanor takes the ‘OK’ as a win, and that Tyler has agree her terms. Tyler moves Eleanor’s hair softly with his hand. (Alternate) Tyler kisses Eleanor.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: What are you doing? With the fuzzy pink handcuffs that were dangling from the mirror, Tyler uses slight of hand to lock Eleanor to the Firebird’s steering wheel. As he exits, he looks back and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No one is going to die today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak sits in a metal folding chair paying close attention Salt Water coaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be aggressive, steer the match where you want it to go. Zak nods his head, not confident. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) You can talk to Sam, but just keep it small and quiet. Don’t let the audience in too much. Just remember to roll with it, take the punches and then come back harder. As far as your smack talk goes, the moment you get in the ring say the meanest most evil thing you can think of to get in his head and rile the audience up good. (beat) You gotta say the most MANIACAL thing you can possibly think of. Zak looks scared. Tyler approaches, having left Eleanor in the car. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) If you start to bleed use it to your advantage, play it up. Maybe wipe it all over your face. (beat) OK, I’ll be in the stands watching. Salt Water pats Zak on the shoulder and walks away. As he is leaving, he slaps Tyler on the chest once and excitedly screams in his face. Tyler salutes. Zak sits, still shaken by Salt Water’s words.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Tyler?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No. Don’t you do that. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: You know you can do this, you've got this. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Say “I’ve got this.”

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Say “I’ve got this!” Say it to me.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I’ve got this?

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: No. Not like you’re asking me if you've got it, say it like you know it’s true. Zak doesn't respond. Tyler grabs him by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say it! Say it to me! Make me believe it! (beat) Make me believe. Long pause as they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: I've got this.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you.

dialogues.speaker: I'VE GOT THIS
dialogues.text: Tyler smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Good. I knew you did. I just needed you to know. (beat) Let’s find something to dress you in. curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig speaks into his flip phone.  90.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Nah, man I’m telling you he’s here. (beat) Yeah, I saw him plain as day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ratboy watches Duncan who is lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: RATBOY
dialogues.text: Whatcha gonna do? Duncan takes off his hat and tosses it aside with purpose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stands in the middle of the ring on top of a chair speaking into his bullhorn. He is being circled by Samson, sweaty, still holding the barbed wire bat and wearing the gold belt. Zak stands in the darkness, just beyond the stage.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: We were going to pack it up and head home having already crowned a champion for today. The crowd cheers fueling Samson’s rage.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But then, at the very last second, an old friend showed up. Salt Water stands up among the crowd and raises his arms. crowd claps.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Salt Water Redneck has with him today a protégé. Someone new to the world of backyard brawling. Someone who was groomed in a different kind of wrestling mentality. INT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S FIREBIRD - DAY Eleanor rifles through the glove box.  91.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Someone who maybe isn’t cut out for this kind of thing!? Not cut out for this kind of grit! Eleanor finds an old screw driver and tries to jam it int the keyhole of the handcuffs. The crowd boos, and Eleanor moves with more urgency.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: A different kind of hero perhaps? I asked Samson, I asked him if he would take this last minute fight and he didn’t want to. He said it wasn’t worth his time. Samson hits his chest hard like a wild animal.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But then I told Samson that not only did this newcomer call hima coward...but he called him weak, and a liar! The crowd boos. Zak looks on from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: (to himself) I did not say that.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON
dialogues.text: I’m going to eat him alive!

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: He said that Samson is a liar and doesn’t deserve that belt because he’s not the best. He said that Samson deserves nothing but to lick the dirt off his boots! The crowd boos.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lets hear it for... He takes out the scrap piece of paper Salt Water gave him earlier and reads it aloud.  92.

dialogues.speaker: THE PEANUT BUTTER FALCON
dialogues.text: The fiery painted doors to the barn slide open to reveal he steps out wearing a handmade Falcon costume made of ca board, duct tape, sticks, and strips of fabric. He looks magnificent. The roaring crowd goes silent, as Zak stands looking arou at everyone. Salt Water looks on from the stands with pride. Tyler, already in Zak's corner, watches Zak from the side the ring with a towel draped over his shoulder. Zak waves to everyone and smiles. People, not knowing what to do, stiffly wave back. Zak breaks the tension and goes into a flexing routine. He roars loudly. The crowd loses it and starts cheering for Zak as he make his way into the ring with a splendid display of dance mo and flexing poses. The crowd is going ape shit. Everyone is on Zak’s side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak's body flies through the air. He hits the mat hard. The crowd winces in pain. Samson roars. Zak tries to get up. Samson grabs Zak’s leg just as he is about to stand, flip him over, then leg drops on top of Zak, making the ring s violently. Tyler is starting to show worry on his face.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Get up, Zak! Get up! Zak looks to Tyler.  93. Samson grabs Zak's face and pulls it close to his so no o but Zak can hear his angry whisper.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’ve been doing this twenty five years. I’ve made this my life. I love this, you can’t just step in the ring and expect me to lay down for you. Sam shoves Zak hard, then pulls him in again, face to fac

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t care who you are, or what Clint wants. I’m not running a Make-A-Wish Foundation. Sam slides his arm under Zak’s torso and body slams him h into the mat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan and Ratboy speed down the road in their camouflage truck, intent on retribution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson throws Zak toward the ropes, and then plants himse in the center of the ring. Zak bounces off the ropes and is slingshotted back toward Samson. Samson dodges Zak’s attempt at a clothesline and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON
dialogues.text: (so the crowd can hear) You think you can come here and challenge me!? IN MY HOUSE!? Zak lays a slap across Samson’s chest. The crowd musters up a halfhearted cheer. It appears Zak might be making a come back.

dialogues.speaker: AGAIN
dialogues.text: Zak slaps Samson as hard as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zak winds up and slaps him as hard as possible. Samson isn't fazed, he grabs a florescent light bulb from sidelines and smashes himself in the head with it. Blood pours from cuts on his forehead as he laughs like a maniac and a true villain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tires come to a stop. Ratboy and Duncan get out of their truck. Duncan grabs a tire iron from behind his seat. The two walk through the parking lot past all the empty c Eleanor, still handcuffed inside the Firebird sees them a her eyes widen. She starts to kick the steering wheel violently, nothing will keep her from warning Tyler and Z

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson does a flying kick and sends Zak across the ring. Tyler looks on, saddened by what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON
dialogues.text: (yelling for the crowd) You come in my house with that kind of disrespect and you get served. I don't give a shit who you are! (he points to Zak) I‘1l eat you like a flank steak! Zak lies in the corner where Tyler is, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my belt... He lifts his huge gold belt high in the air for Zak to se The crowd quiets. Samson points at Zak.  95.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-and if someone is going to try to take it from me they better not be as WEAK as this little turd right here. You're weak. You’re sad. And you’re pathetic. YOU WEAK,

dialogues.speaker: WEAK LITTLE BITCH
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (so only Zak can hear) You know you’re just a retard. The crowd gets quiet. Tyler and Zak share a long look.

dialogues.speaker: SALT WATER REDNECK
dialogues.text: (to himself) Say something. Duncan and Ratboy make their way through the crowd. Dunca holds the tire iron tight in his right hand. Zak slowly gets to his feet. He looks at Samson and starts breathing heavily. Zak raises one hand and points his index finger at Samson He means business. The crowd sits silently on the edge of their seats. Tyler watches Zak intently.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: You are not invited...

dialogues.speaker: TO MY BIRTHDAY PARTY
dialogues.text: Samson looks confused and scared. Everything begins moving in slow motion. Zak takes off running across the ring. He grabs Samson and begins to lift him off the ground. The crowd watches in disbelief. Salt Water begins to stand up.  96. Tyler, his body framed perfectly by the wall of fire behi him, stands; wide eyed and amazed. Duncan approaches Tyler from behind. Tyler watches Zak, unaware of the danger behind him, full enthralled with the moment. Eleanor has gotten free and is recklessly shoving her bod through the crowd like a rugby player. Duncan begins to raise the tire iron. Zak fights to lift Samson fully over his head, but he get done. Tyler is welling with tears watching Zak, as Duncan swing the tire iron from above. Zak releases Samson's body into the air on a trajectory o of the ring that is almost unbelievable. Duncan’s tire iron is now inches from landing across the of Tyler’s skull. Tyler looks content as Zak realizes his dream. The tire iron finds its resting place, metal crack bone. Everything goes black. Baptism by fire.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: BEGIN MONTAGE of closing imagery. --Duncan and Ratboy being placed in the back of a cop car --Salt Water sits quietly on the steps of his trailer, drinking a beer and looking toward his makeshift ring. --Eleanor and Zak sitting somberly in a hospital waiting as a doctor approaches. Eleanor wipes tears from her eyes Zak gets up and walks away. Eleanor takes her diamond earrings out and trades them wi an orderly in the hospital parking lot for the keys to a 1984 Monte Carlo.  97. --Zak sits in front of a birthday cake with three lit candles. He closes his eyes tight, mumbles a few inaudibl words, and blows out the candles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: INT. ELEANOR’S MONTE CARLO - DAY - TRAVELING Eleanor drives with a quiet confidence. More than ever in life she is in control of her own destiny. Zak sleeps in the passenger seat beside her. Eleanor nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR
dialogues.text: Zak, wake up, look. Zak perks up and looks forward out the window. He squeezes his hands with excitement. The car passes a “Welcome to Florida” sign.

dialogues.speaker: ZAK
dialogues.text: Florida! We are in Florida! Eleanor nods. Zak turns around to the backseat. There, asleep in a hospital gown, is Tyler. The right sid his head is shaved, staples and dried blood cover the ski where his hair used to be. Eleanor smiles to herself, she is taking care of the peop she loves. Zak and Tyler are the family she chooses. Tyler looks peaceful even though his eyes are blackened a dried blood lines his nostrils. Zak smiles at Tyler, he reaches back and gently does thei secret handshake to Tyler’s limp hands. Eleanor reaches back and puts her hand on top of theirs. Tyler's eyes open the slightest amount. He lets out a sof moan and a smile cracks across his lips.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. FADE TO BLACK.
